author: Wilbur Jenkins

text: @jricket I agree. The music was one of the many reasons why I loved to play this game so much. It is in my humble opinion one of the most perfect JRPGs ever made. I sometimes find myself humming along with the music when I decide to play through it again.
author: Seph Bentos

text: great song and great OST.  I never understood why people complained about BOF3's music.  They say it is a medieval themed RPG (which is wrong, it's sci-fi) with this weird jazz fusion music which is 'wrong'.  And how is the usual classical/rock/jpop inspired music for most RPGs 'right'?  If historical musical accuracy was important, the OST for these games would consist of monks chanting unison melodies with no rhythm or harmony.
